IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: For the conduct of a college preparatory school for boys.
IRS990.MissionDesc: MCCALLIE IS A PRIVATE SCHOOL WITH STATE-OF-THE-ART FACILITIES NESTLED ON 100 ACRES ON CHATTANOOGAS MISSIONARY RIDGE. SINCE 1905, MCCALLIE HAS REMAINED COMMITTED TO PROVIDING AN OUTSTANDING COLLEGE PREPARATORY EDUCATION PROGRAM FOR BOYS.
IRS990.Desc: MCCALLIE PROVIDED APPROXIMATELY 900 STUDENTS IN 6TH THROUGH 12TH GRADES WITH EDUCATIONAL AND ACADEMIC SERVICES. THERE ARE BOARDING AND DAY STUDENTS PARTICIPATING IN OVER 40 STUDENT-CENTERED ORGANIZATIONS AND AN OUTSTANDING ARRAY OF EXTRA-CURRICULAR ACTIVITIES. THESE INCLUDE NATIONALLY RECOGNIZED PROGRAMS IN ATHLETICS, IN THE ARTS, AND COMMUNITY SERVICE. PROGRAMS PREPARE STUDENTS FOR LIFE THROUGH INSPIRING AND MOTIVATING THEM TO ALWAYS STRIVE FOR EXCELLENCE; PURSUE INTELLECTUAL AND SPIRITUAL TRUTH; LEAD LIVES OF HONOR; ACT RESPONSIBLY IN PERSONAL, FAMILY, AND COMMUNITY RELATIONSHIPS; AND DEMONSTRATE CONCERN FOR THE WELFARE OF OTHERS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: MCCALLIE INCUBATED A PROGRAM CALLED THE NATIONAL CENTER FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF BOYS (NCDB), WHICH WAS CREATED TO HELP EDUCATORS, PARENTS, AND MENTORS LEARN HOW BEST TO HELP BOYS THRIVE AND LEARN. NCDB SHARES RESEARCH AND BEST PRACTICES THROUGH SEMINARS, WORKSHOPS, PUBLICATIONS AND OTHER PLATFORMS AS IT CONNECTS RESEARCHERS, EDUCATORS, PARENTS, AND OTHERS WHO RAISE, MENTOR, AND EDUCATE BOYS.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: The McCallie School has received unusual grants over the following years: Year Ended 06/30/2012 = $2,804,160 Year Ended 06/30/2014 = $16,999,965 Year Ended 06/30/2015 = $2,075,664 Year Ended 06/30/2016 = $1,229,349

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: McCallie's Endowment is intended to provide support to the institution in perpetuity in such categories as need-based and merit-based financial aid and faculty professional development, as well as to provide unrestricted support to the school.

McCallie is recognized as an organization exempt from income taxes under Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code (the "Code"). Only unrelated business income, as defined by Section 512(a)(1) of the Code, is subject to income taxes. McCallie's unrelated business income is not significant. The School annually evaluates all federal and state income tax positions. This process includes an analysis of whether these income tax positions McCallie takes meet the definition of an uncertain tax position under the Income Taxes Topic of the Financial Accounting Standards Codification. In genreal, McCallie is no longer subject to tax examinations for the tax years ended before June 30, 2013.
6,827,553 Financial Aid Grants 402,055 - Inventory - Cost of Goods Sold 41,328 - Change in Value of Split Interest Agreement 27,784 - Direct Fundraising Expense -------------------------- 6,356,386 =

Financial Aid Grants
Disclosure in registration info packet, newspaper ad.
Recipients are chosen based on financial need.
All grants offered by the school are applied as offsets to tuition and fees and therefore satisfy the requirements to be used for proper purposes.

AS PART OF THE HEADMASTERS CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT, HE IS REQUIRED TO LIVE ON CAMPUS IN A RESIDENCE PROVIDED TO HIM BY THE SCHOOL. CLEANING, MAINTENANCE, AND UTILITIES ARE PROVIDED FOR THIS RESIDENCE AT THE EXPENSE OF THE SCHOOL. THE SCHOOL PROVIDES FOR A SOCIAL CLUB MEMBERSHIP FOR THE HEADMASTER, AS WELL AS A DISCRETIONARY SPENDING ACCOUNT. Additionally, the headmaster received a gross-up payment for certain taxable benefits.

THE SCHOOL HAS A DEFINED BENEFIT PLAN WHICH WAS FROZEN IN 2005. CERTAIN EMPLOYEES ARE ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE BENEFITS UNDER THIS PLAN IF THEY MET CERTAIN REQUIREMENTS IN 2005. A Lee Burns participates in a section 457(f) plan. Contributions to the plan for the calendar year totaled $90,200.
THE SCHOOL PAID PERFORMANCE BONUSES TO CERTAIN MEMBERS OF MANAGEMENT DURING 2015-16.

IssuerName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: The Health Educational and Housing Facility Boar
The Health Educational and Housing Facility Boar
The Health Educational and Housing Facility Boar
The Health Educational and Housing Facility Boar

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule K, Part I, Bond Issues:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: (a) Full Name of Issuer: The Health, Educational, and Housing Facility Board of the City of Chattanooga, Tennessee Bond Issues Listed: A - Educational Facilities Revenue Bonds (The McCallie School Project) Series 2015E B - Educational Facilities Revenue Bonds (The McCallie School Project) Series 2015F C - Educational Facilities Revenue Bonds (The McCallie School Project) Series 2015G D - Educational Facilities Revenue Bonds (The McCallie School Project) Series 2015H (f) Description of Purpose A - The Series 2015E Bonds were a reissuance and current refunding of the Issuer's Variable Rate Demand Revenue Bonds (The McCallie School Project) Series 2015A dated April 13, 2015 The Series 2015A Bonds were a reissuance and current refunding of a portion of the Issuer's Educational Facilities Revenue Refunding Bonds (The McCallie School Project) Series 2009 dated October 14, 2009 The Proceeds of the series 2009 Bonds were used to refund the Issuer's Variable Rate Demand Revenue Bonds (The McCallie School Project) Series 1991 dated July 2, 1991 and a portion of the Issuer's Educational Facilities Revenue Refunding Bonds (The McCallie School Project) Series 1998 dated November 19, 1998. The Proceeds of the Series 1991 Bonds were used for acquisition, construction and equipping of additions and improvements to the Organization's campus facilities in Chattanooga, Tennessee. The proceeds of the Series 1998 Bonds were used for aquisition and construction of a middle school facility and related improvements; acquisition of buses; acquisition and installation of equipment; and acquisition of approximately three acres of land located on various parecels for expansion of the campus. B - The Series 2015F Bonds were a reissuance and current refunding of the Issuer's Educational Facilities Revenue Bonds (The McCallie School Project) Series 2015B dated April 15, 2015. The Series 2015B Bonds were a reissuance and current refunding of a portion of the Issuer's Educational Facilities Revenue Refunding Bonds (The McCallie School Project) Series 2009 dated October 14, 2009. The purpose of the Series 2009 Bonds are described above. C - The Series 2015G Bonds were a reissuance and current refunding of the Issuer's Educational Facilities Revenue Bonds (The McCallie School Project) Series 2015C dated May 15, 2015. The Series 2015C Bonds were a reissuance and current refunding of a portion of the Issuer's Educational Facilities Revenue Refunding Bonds (The McCallie School Project) Series 2009 dated October 14, 2009. The purpose of the Series 2009 Bonds are described above. D - The Series 2015H Bonds were a reissuance and current refunding of the Issuer's Educational Facilities Revenue Bonds (The McCallie School Project) Series 2015D dated June 1, 2015. The Series 2015D Bonds were a reissuance and current refunding of a portion of the Issuer's Educational Facilities Revenue Refunding Bonds (The McCallie School Project) Series 2010 dated May 3, 2010. The proceeds of the series 2010 were used to refinance a portion of the Series 1998 Bonds. The purpose of the Series 1998 Bonds are described above.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part I, Column B - Items Contributed
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Column B reports number of Items Received.
The McCallie School uses Benjamin F Edwards & Co as a third party to sell donated stock.
DURING THE FISCAL YEAR, THE ORGANIZATION STARTED A PROGRAM CALLED THE NATIONAL CENTER FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF BOYS TO HELP EDUCATORS, PARENTS, AND MENTORS LEARN HOW BEST TO HELP BOYS THRIVE AND LEARN.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE 990 IS MADE AVAILABLE ELECTRONICALLY TO THE FULL BOARD OF TRUSTEES FOR THEIR REVIEW PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A CONFLICT OF INTEREST FORM IS COMPLETED ANNUALLY BY EACH TRUSTEE AND DIVISION HEAD. POTENTIAL CONFLICTS ARE REVIEWED BY THE AUDIT COMMITTEE. TRUSTEES RECUSE THEMSELVES FROM VOTING ON ANY MATTER WHERE THEY HAVE CONFLICTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE USES COMPARABILITY INFORMATION PROVIDED BY THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCE IN DETERMINING HEADMASTER COMPENSATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Officer and key employee compensation are determined by comparable pay within the industry.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COPIES OF DOCUMENTS ARE MAINTAINED BY THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCE AND PROVIDED UPON REQUEST AS APPROPRIATE.

AUDIT COMMITTEE MEETS ANNUALLY WITH AUDITORS, REVIEWS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, MAKES ANY RECOMMENDATIONS NECESSARY TO BOARD, AND THE BOARD VOTES TO ACCEPT AUDIT AND/OR APPROVES AUDIT COMMITTEE RECOMMENDATIONS.
The Charitable Remainder Trusts are Domiciled in Tennessee, Florida, and Colorado.
